page.title: 14HIGHNAM COURT
page.content: This 17th century brick-built house has long been the centre of life in Highnam.Earlier buildings belonged to Gloucester Abbey,the country residence of the abbots.After the Dissolution it passed through the families of the Arnolds,Lucys and the Cookes who built the present house in the later years of the Commonwealth.In 1838 it was bought from the Guise family by Thomas Gambier-Parry from Surrey.A man of many parts,he used his wealth improving his house,gardens and estate and built a church and school for the village. The house today is a centre for the arts,particularly music,with frequent workshops and concerts.It was the early home of{COURTYARD ARTS TRUST}, now known as Gloucester Arts.
